result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heriberto Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($10,000.00) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court.  Paul Hauer for Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Oral Decision proceeds. For the reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Defense motion. 
Defense requests the case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 1-29-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Assistant District Attorney Karl Hayes, received and filed.
Submitted by Defense Attorney Matthew Luening, received and filed.
Supplemental Briefing filed by Assistant District Attorney Karl Hayes, received and filed.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion Hearing proceeded. Sworn and examined for the Defense is Heriberto Ramirez. Defense rests. 
Sworn and examined for the State as a rebuttal witness is officer Andrew Molina. State rests. Closing Arguments given. 
Any additional written closing argument by the State to be filed no later than 10-31-2014 by 5:00 p.m., any response by the Defense is due no later than 11-7-2014 by 5:00 p.m. and any reply by the State is due no later than 11-10-2014 by 5:00 p.m. 
Court orders case adjourned for Oral Decision on 11-14-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.  Oral ruling scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion Hearing proceeds. Sworn for the Defense: Heriberto Ramirez. Court orders case adjourned for Motion Hearing on 10-28-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa  Motion hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motion Hearing proceeded. Sworn and examined for the State: Officer Christopher Ederesinghe, City of Milwaukee Police Officer. Defense cross-examined. State redirects. Sworn and examined for the State: Officer Molina, City of Milwaukee Police Officer. Defese cross-examined. State redirects. Court orders case adjourned for Motion Hearing on 10-3-2014 at 3:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez and Sarah Guzman.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Guzman.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case set for motion hearing.  Due to delay in spanish interpreter services for today's proceedings. All parties are notified that effective 8-03-14 this case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
-State's Response To Defendant's Motion To Supprss Evidence; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Filed by the Defense;  Motion to Suppress Evidence, Memorandum of Law in Support of Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence.  alp
Memorandum of Law In Support of Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed by Attorney Matthew T. Luening.
Defendant's Motion To Suppress Evidence, filed by Attorney Matthew T. Luening.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew T Luening.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hayes).  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sworn as interpreter:  Alejandra Klaric.  No motions filed by the defense.  Court grants defense request for an adjournment.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

14RM025871  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-14-14

Attorney Matthew T Luening in court, defendant Heriberto Ramirez not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denied defense motion of modification of bail.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew T Luening in court, defendant Heriberto Ramirez not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-14-2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Dawn Maldonado.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Heriberto Ramirez in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
